features: QUICK HEAT UP TIME: The 1.1 ounce water tank heats up in one minute, equipped with 1-touch steam control and 3 temperature settings for various fabric types. Fill included measuring cup with water up to maximum mark.
EQUIPPED FOR THE JOB: 350 watts of power removes wrinkles from almost any fabric, a non-stick sole plate resists rust buildup, and an 8-foot power cord provides reachability.
DUAL VOLTAGE CONVENIENCE: Sized and equipped for travel anywhere in the world, just select between 120 and 220 volts.
VERSATILE DESIGN: Compact size is perfect for quilting, travel, craft projects, and more.
body.description: Product Description Steam irons have been a staple of removing wrinkles from dress clothes for years – however many are bulky and inefficiently designed. The Sharper Image SI-755 is sleek, simple and small with a mighty ability to set crisp creases and remove wrinkles. It is strong enough for everyday use at home, yet lightweight and compact for taking along with you. If you travel, or if you simply need to touch up garments away from home, the SI-755 Dual Voltage Travel Iron is an ideal appliance. From the Manufacturer IMPORTANT INTERNATIONAL DISCLAIMER: This item is built to meet U.S. voltage requirements and may not function properly when used in conjunction with external devices that alter or convert voltage or frequency of electricity. Improper use or shipping the product outside the U.S. will void all warranties.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Sharper Image SI-755 Mini Steam Iron with Dual Voltage Steam irons have been a staple of removing wrinkles from dress clothes for years – however many are bulky and inefficiently designed. The Sharper Image SI-755 is sleek, simple and small with a mighty ability to set crisp creases and remove wrinkles. It is strong enough for everyday use at home, yet lightweight and compact for taking along with you. If you travel, or if you simply need to touch up garments away from home, the SI-755 Dual Voltage Travel Iron is an ideal appliance.

Steady steam. 4 steam outlets produce 6 minutes of continuous steam that is gentle yet effective on fabrics. Fill cup included for added convenience. Quick heat-up time. SI-755 heats up quickly and is ready to use in just 1 minute. The control dial allows you to select between 3 temperatures for use on a variety of fabrics. Sleek design. A lockable, push-button control activates the steam function. The handle, which contains the unit's water tank, is ergonomically designed for comfort and practicality.

Perfect for travel. Dual voltage capability make SI-755 great for travel anywhere in the world. Use the recessed switch to select between 120 and 220 volts. Great on-the-go or at home. Compact, lightweight, and portable design allows you to refresh your clothes anywhere you go without the use of harsh chemicals. Quilting, crafting, and more. Small but mighty, the SI-755 will get into places bigger irons can't reach to set crisp creases and remove wrinkles, making it ideal for quilting, crafting, and more.

The Clever Style of Comfort Since 1977 Sharper Image has been creating products that enhance your life. With the home comfort line of products, Sharper Image is creating a more thoughtful approach to deliver clever, well-thought-out solutions that enhance your comfort at home, work or while exploring. These home comfort products share the new look of Sharper Image, and we have a dedicated home comfort support team ready to help with any questions or support you may need.

SI-755 Mini Steam Iron SI-770 Iron and Fabric Steamer SI-470 Full Size Garment Steamer SI-160 Steam Mop SI-380 Canister Steam Cleaner Water Capacity 1.2 oz. 3.4 oz. 54 oz. 8.5 oz. 54 oz. reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Small but powerful
reviews.reviewText: This little iron works great for me when traveling. It’s a little messy to fill but heats quickly and irons my clothes very well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this travel iron!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this travel iron for a trip to Spain and Italy. It does NOT come with a converter plug so you must purchase a converter in order to use this in other countries. Besides the fact that it needs a converter plug to work, it is a GREAT little iron. I didn’t want to mess with distilled water and a liquid mess in my luggage so I didn’t use a steamer or the steamer feature of the iron but this iron worked beautifully dry. It heats up quickly and is easy to use without an ironing board which is not always available when traveling. It is very lightweight and takes up very little space in luggage. I highly recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sweet little workhorse, gentle for arthritic hands!
reviews.reviewText: I spend 2 to 5 hours a day sewing masks. When arthritis attacked my hands it became quite painful to work beyond an hour using my old trusty tailoring iron that I’ve used for years and years, but when I bought this little travel iron, once again I could sew as many hours a day as I wanted/needed to. I haven’t weighed it but it isn’t any heavier than my cell phone, and the handle is configured so I don’t even have to grip it like a teakettle (as I do to hold the big one) but can hook it with 2 fingers if I want. The plate is shaped exactly the same as the shape of the masks, and being small, it fits into the crannies where the large iron doesn’t. The 2nd photo shows you the size difference in the two irons.I love this little iron! I don’t mind that I have to refill it often as the water vessel doesn’t hold much, it provides ample steam when I want it. And the range of heat is just as good as the big iron. The only caveat is something I read about in the reviews before I bought it, that’s the short life. I know it’s meant as a travel iron, not to be used 2 to 5 hours a day, 7 days a week, and I was prepared to replace it in about a year, but no, it only lasted 3 months and 12 days after delivery - 2 months and 13 days after the return deadline. This morning it was totally unresponsive. So today, after making one mask using the big, 20 lb iron, I bit the bullet and ordered another sweet little workhorse. At this price I'll just consider it a subscription item that makes it possible for me to keep up the pace making my masks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Small but powerful
reviews.reviewText: Needed travel iron for Europe and it worked perfectly and despite its small size was able to iron out creases easily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I got this iron for crafting purposes. I love that it’s small & versatile. Dry or steam. Low to high heat settings. The only way it could improve is to have auto shutoff, which it doesn’t. I also got the clamshell case & it stores nicely.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Wanted this for sewing group. Perfect for travel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A decent iron with poor handle design
reviews.reviewText: Seemed like a decent iron but I found the handle awkward and uncomfortable. I returned it and purchased the Quilted Bear mini iron. The handle is more ergonomic (easy on the wrist) and it is incredibly fast to heat up

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024

reviews.reviewText: Pretty good for a travel iron. It had dual voltage and that's exactly what we needed.
It does not become really hot but it's ok.It is really nice for little sewing projects. I love it. It came in a neat box

Me gustó mucho. Pequeña, ligera y te resuelve el tema de las arrugas en la ropa durante los viajes. Estuve en un viaje de 1 semana de trabajo y me funcionó muy bien. Es cierto que el diseño del cable podría mejorar para que no estorbe pero en general te acomodas. Sí la recomiendo.
Excelente para viajes !!Súper práctica, yo no salgo sin ella, sobre todo a Sudamérica….(😒) pero lleva un convertidor…
